text: Asado () is the barbecue of a social event in Hispanic/Latin culture. They are popular in Argentina, Chile, Paraguay and Uruguay. In these countries, asado is a traditional way of preparing food and a traditional event. An asado usually has of beef, sausages, and sometimes other meats, which are cooked on a grill, called a parrilla, or an open fire. ==References== Category:South American culture Category:Meat
title: Asado
